slow-tour.title: A Glimpse Of Bhutan
slow-tour.tagline: Immerse yourself in Bhutan's rich cultural heritage
slow-tour.description: Discover the authentic soul of Bhutan through its vibrant villages, warm homestays, and timeless traditions. This thoughtfully designed 7-day journey takes you from the bustling streets of Thimphu to the serene valleys of Punakha and the sacred heights of Tiger's Nest, offering a genuine connection to the people, culture, and spirit of the Himalayas.

pricing.note: Based on double occupancy. Single supplement available at an additional cost of $240.

highlights: Explore ancient dzongs and fortresses in Paro, Thimphu, and Punakha
Stroll through lush valleys, rice terraces, and riverside trails
Experience local village life through an authentic homestay / farmhouse

itinerary.title: Welcome to the Land of the Thunder Dragon
itinerary.description: Arrive at Paro International Airport and journey to Bhutan's capital, Thimphu. Visit Memorial Chorten, a prominent stupa dedicated to Bhutan's third king, the Takin Preservation Centre to see Bhutan's endangered national animal, then enjoy panoramic views of the Thimphu Valley from Sangaygang Viewpoint. Sightsee Tashichho Dzong, a grand fortress that houses Bhutan's government offices and Bhutan's Buddhist monks before ending the day with a welcome dinner featuring traditional Bhutanese cuisine.

itinerary.title: Road to the Peaceful Punakha Valley
itinerary.description: Begin the day with a visit to Buddha Dordenma, a towering statue overlooking Thimphu Valley, before continuing over the scenic Dochula Pass, where 108 chortens crown the mountain ridge and offer spectacular views of the Himalayan range. Continue to Punakha, Bhutan's former capital, and enjoy a gentle walk through artistic Sopsokha Village, past rice terraces and mustard fields, to reach the sacred Chimi Lhakhang Fertility Temple.

itinerary.title: Farm to Heart: A Canvas of Village Life in Punakha
itinerary.description: Embrace the simple rhythms of rural life in Punakha by joining your hosts in daily farm activities, from milking cows and tending to seasonal paddy fields to learning how to cook a traditional Bhutanese meal. Then try your hand at Bhutan's national sport, archery. Visit the majestic Punakha Dzong, Bhutan's former seat of government, a riverside fortress at the confluence of the Pho and Mo Chhu rivers, and cross the longest suspension bridge in Bhutan, Punakha Suspension Bridge.

itinerary.title: Craft Your Bhutan Memory
itinerary.description: Visit Choki Traditional Art School, local textile museum and paper factory to draw inspiration for your next activity. Take part in a hands-on workshop of your choice, guided by a local artist. Choose from mineral pigment art, clay sculpture, or traditional motif painting, and take your creation home as a meaningful souvenir from Bhutan. Afterwards, explore the vibrant Centenary Farmers Market, where locals gather to trade fresh produce and regional specialties.

itinerary.title: Unveiling the Charm of Paro
itinerary.description: Travel from Thimphu to Paro, stopping along the way at the Tachog Lhakhang Iron Suspension Bridge, then visit Kyichu Lhakhang, one of Bhutan's oldest temples. Continue to Rinpung Dzong, Paro's iconic riverside fortress, and nearby Ta Dzong, a former watchtower now home to the National Museum, to learn more about Bhutan's history and culture. Enjoy a relaxed afternoon wandering Paro's charming streets, lined with arts and crafts shops and cozy cafés.

itinerary.title: The Ascent to Tiger's Nest
itinerary.description: Start your day early with a hike to Paro Taktsang (Tiger's Nest Monastery), a sacred Buddhist monastery nestled high on a cliff at 3,120 m above the Paro Valley, renowned for its breathtaking views and spiritual significance. After descending, relax in an optional traditional hot stone bath — the perfect way to soothe your body and mind and reflect on your journey through Bhutan.

itinerary.title: Until Next Time, Bhutan
itinerary.description: Depart from Paro Airport, carrying with you cherished memories of Bhutan's culture, landscapes, and the spirit of the Himalayas.

mountain-biking.title: Bhutan Mountain Biking & Cultural Adventure
mountain-biking.tagline: Cycle through Bhutan's scenic valleys and cultural heartlands
mountain-biking.description: Cycle across Bhutan's breathtaking Himalayan landscapes — from the iconic Chele La Pass with sweeping views of Mt. Jomolhari to peaceful valleys, riverside trails, and cultural landmarks, on an immersive journey through the heart of the Himalayas.

pricing.note: Based on double occupancy. Single supplement available at an additional cost of $240.

highlights: Cycle up to Chele La Pass, Bhutan's highest motorable mountain pass
Live like a local with homestay/farmhouse stays, including hands-on Bhutanese cooking and archery experiences
Ride through lush valleys, mountain landscapes, riverside trails, and local villages across the Himalayas
Visit Bhutan's ancient dzongs (fortresses), temples and iconic cultural landmarks

itinerary.title: Welcome to the Land of the Thunder Dragon
itinerary.description: Arrive at Paro International Airport and journey to Bhutan's capital, Thimphu. Visit Memorial Chorten, a prominent stupa dedicated to Bhutan's third king, the Takin Preservation Centre to see Bhutan's endangered national animal, then enjoy panoramic views of the Thimphu Valley from Sangaygang Viewpoint. Sightsee Tashichho Dzong, a grand fortress that houses Bhutan's government offices and Bhutan's Buddhist monks before ending the day with a welcome dinner featuring traditional Bhutanese cuisine.

itinerary.title: Pedal Into the Peaceful Punakha Valley
itinerary.description: Begin the day with a short drive to Buddha Dordenma, a towering statue overlooking Thimphu Valley, before cycling over the scenic Dochula Pass (21 km), where 108 chortens crown the mountain ridge and offer spectacular views of the Himalayan range. Continue downhill to Punakha, Bhutan's former capital, and enjoy a short ride through artistic Sopsokha Village (39 km), past rice terraces and mustard fields, to reach the sacred Chimi Lhakhang Fertility Temple (1 km) then to the homestay (14 km).
itinerary.statsImageAlt: Elevation profile for Day 2 — Dochula Pass to Punakha

itinerary.title: Rhythms of Rural Punakha
itinerary.description: Embrace the simple rhythms of rural life in Punakha at the homestay by learning how to cook a traditional Bhutanese meal and try your hand at Bhutan's national sport, archery. Then, embark on a serene ride to and across the Punakha Suspension Bridge (3 km), the longest suspension bridge in Bhutan, and continue to the majestic Punakha Dzong (1 km), Bhutan's former seat of government, a riverside fortress at the confluence of the Pho and Mo Chhu rivers, before returning to Paro by car.
itinerary.statsImageAlt: Elevation profile for Day 3 — Punakha valley ride

itinerary.title: Summiting Chele La Pass
itinerary.description: Cycle from Paro to conquer Chele La Pass (42 km), Bhutan's highest motorable pass, where the journey climbs to soaring heights — prayer flags strung across the ridge, alpine forests below, and, on clear days, the striking peak of Jomolhari commanding the skyline — before an exhilarating ride back down (42 km) to the hotel in Paro.
itinerary.statsImageAlt: Elevation profile for Day 4 — Chele La Pass summit

itinerary.title: Unveiling the Charm of Paro
itinerary.description: Set off on an easy ride to Kyichu Lhakhang (4 km), one of Bhutan's oldest temples, then continue to Rinpung Dzong (7 km), Paro's iconic riverside fortress, and nearby Ta Dzong (2 km), a former watchtower now home to the National Museum, to discover Bhutan's history and culture. Wind down with a gentle ride through Paro's charming streets (3 km), lined with arts and crafts shops and cozy cafés, easing into a slower pace before returning to the hotel (2 km).
